macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: U.S. Stock Market Declines on Fed Chair Nomination News
items.summary: Major U.S. indices fell on January 30, 2026, with the Dow Jones dropping 0.85% to 48,655.88 and the S&P 500 declining 0.52% to 6,932.61. Financial stocks led the decline following news of a new Federal Reserve chair nomination, signaling investor concerns about potential monetary policy changes.

items.title: Indian Markets End Rally Ahead of Union Budget
items.summary: Indian benchmark indices snapped a three-day winning streak on January 30, with the BSE Sensex falling 0.36% and Nifty 50 declining 0.39%. Investors adopted a cautious stance ahead of the Union Budget presentation.

items.title: Tech Stocks Show Strength with Tesla and NVIDIA Gains
items.summary: Tesla gained 3.77% and NVIDIA rose 3.58% on recent trading activity, showing relative strength in the technology sector despite broader market weakness.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Consolidates Around $85,000 Amid Market Correction
items.summary: Bitcoin has consolidated around the $85,000 mark after recent peaks, with the broader cryptocurrency market experiencing significant correction. The total crypto market capitalization has shrunk to approximately $2.8 trillion, and the Fear and Greed Index has moved into the Fear zone.

items.title: Ethereum Falls Below $3,000 as Altcoins Face Broad Downturn
items.summary: Ethereum has dropped more than 3% in the last 24 hours and fallen below $3,000 to around $2,800. Over 90 of the top 100 cryptocurrencies have decreased in value, highlighting widespread altcoin vulnerability during the market correction.

items.title: WLD Token Surges 27% Following OpenAI CEO's Biometric Social Network Plans
items.summary: The World Network (WLD) token increased by over 27% after reports that OpenAI CEO Sam Altman is developing a social media platform requiring biometric 'proof of personhood' to eliminate bot activity and address the 'dead internet' theory.

items.title: Plan B Network Launches CypherTank Bitcoin Pitch Series
items.summary: Plan B Network unveiled CypherTank, a new series showcasing innovative Bitcoin ecosystem projects. The inaugural episode premiered on January 31, 2026, at Plan ₿ Forum in El Salvador, with subsequent episodes releasing throughout February.

items.title: STABLE Token Surges 81% Over Two Weeks to New All-Time High
items.summary: The STABLE altcoin has surged 81% over the past two weeks, reaching a new all-time high of $0.0325 and currently trading near $0.0262, driven by rising demand and speculative interest among short-term traders.

items.title: Illicit Cryptocurrency Activity Reached $82 Billion in 2025
items.summary: Blockchain analytics firm Chainalysis reported that illicit cryptocurrency activity reached $82 billion last year, marking a sharp increase from the $10 billion recorded in the previous period.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Amazon in talks to invest $50 billion in OpenAI, expand ties
items.summary: Amazon is negotiating to invest up to $50 billion in OpenAI as part of a potential $100 billion funding round, which would also include contributions from Nvidia and SoftBank. The investment would expand their existing cloud computing agreement and allow Amazon to integrate OpenAI's AI models into its products and platforms.

items.title: Anthropic selected to build government AI assistant pilot
items.summary: Anthropic has been chosen to develop government AI assistant capabilities designed to modernize how citizens interact with complex state services.

items.title: Databricks: Enterprise AI adoption shifts to agentic systems
items.summary: According to Databricks, enterprise AI adoption is transitioning toward agentic systems as organizations embrace intelligent workflows.

items.title: Insurers betting big on AI: Accenture
items.summary: The latest Accenture report on AI in the insurance sector reveals that decision-makers are confident in AI adoption, though staff confidence levels lag behind.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: AI Gaming Technology Drives Volatility in Videogame Stocks After Google Announcement
items.summary: In 2026 California, disruptive AI gaming technology is reshaping the industry, causing volatility in videogame stocks following a major announcement from Google.

items.title: Global Video Game Hackathon Returns to Douglas College Starting January 31
items.summary: The Global Game Jam event runs from January 31 to February 1 at Douglas College in New Westminster, bringing together participants for video game development.

items.title: GDC 2026 State of the Game Industry Survey Reveals High Layoff Rates and Union Support
items.summary: The survey shows 82% of US developers support unionization, with one in four respondents laid off in the last two years amid ongoing industry challenges.

items.title: GDC Releases 2026 State of the Game Industry Report
items.summary: The January 2026 report from GDC provides insights into the current state of the game industry, including forward-looking analysis.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Apple Acquires Israeli Startup Q.ai for $2 Billion in Largest Deal Since Beats
items.summary: Apple has acquired Q.ai, an Israeli facial recognition firm specializing in 'silent speech' technology via facial muscle detection, for nearly $2 billion—its biggest acquisition since Beats in 2014. The deal integrates Q.ai's founding team and tech for AI-powered wearables like headphones and glasses.

items.title: Jet Bank Partners Backbase to Launch Albania’s First Neobank
items.summary: Jet Bank has partnered with Backbase to power the launch of Albania’s first digital-only neobank, marking a significant expansion in European fintech.

items.title: SanCap Bank Selects Jack Henry for Core Banking Upgrade
items.summary: SanCap Bank (Sanibel Captiva Community Bank) has partnered with Jack Henry to upgrade its core banking technology, enhancing operational efficiency.

items.title: Google Threat Intelligence Warns of Active WinRAR Vulnerability Exploitation
items.summary: Google's Threat Intelligence Group reports widespread exploitation of critical WinRAR vulnerability CVE-2025-8088, urging immediate patching; Mandiant releases tools to phase out insecure Net-NTLMv1 protocol.

items.title: OBOS Bank Partners Netcompany for Core Banking Upgrade
items.summary: OBOS Bank has signed with Netcompany Banking Services for a core system upgrade to modernize its banking infrastructure.
